def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):

    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    # if the given number is an even number, return True
    if n == n:
        return True
    # first consider each entry in the list
    i = 0
    while i < len(n):
        # test whether the previous entry is equal to the current entry
        if n[i - 1] == n[i]:
            return True
        # if the current entry is not equal to the previous entry, return False
        else:
            return False
    # return True if all the entries are equal
    return True

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    # Even number
    if n == 0: return False
    # Only even numbers
    if n % 4 == 0: return False
    # Only odd numbers
    if n % 4 > 0: return False
    # Only odd numbers with small numbers
    if n >= (1 << (4 - 1)): return False
    # Only odd numbers with big numbers
    if n >= (1 << (4 + 1)): return False
    # N is not a power of 2
    if not (n % 2 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 4
    if not (n % 4 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 8
    if not (n % 8 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 16
    if not (n % 16 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 32
    if not (n % 32 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 64
    if not (n % 64 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 128
    if not (n % 128 == 0): return False
    # N is not a power of 2147483647
    return False

def is_equal_to_sum_even(n):
    """Evaluate whether the given number n can be written as the sum of exactly 4 positive even numbers
    Example
    is_equal_to_sum_even(4) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(6) == False
    is_equal_to_sum_even(8) == True
    """
    if n % 2 == 0:
        return False

    x = n // 4
    y = n % 4
    m = n % 2
    if m == 0:
        return x == y
    if m!= 0:
        m += 1
    else:
        m = 1
    if m == 0:
        return x == y
    return m == 1
